instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0Amp liquid
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board liquid spill <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is short on signal <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL>.
i remove the component short is remove, but is in the component.
Can I change it to keep on donor board?
thanks
Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0Amp liquid
threads.message:
I can confirm the PMIC from 01041 works on 01700.
It may work from other model also; need to test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0Amp liquid
threads.message: ok thanks, I test and come back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0Amp liquid
threads.message:
i have change the PMIC for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I have 5V 0,050A now.
short is remove, I have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12V
I have <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> short too, when I inject 1V I have T2 chip become hot, can I replace it?
I think 'no' ðŸ™ƒ
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0Amp liquid
threads.message:
Yes, you can replace it; if you can get compatible version with your SSD size.
Of course, you will lose touch ID function; if you can't get it from the same machine, with replacement T2.
